- mac n'cheese: they make three types, all of which my 4 year s old sampled and decided she still like the plain one the best. the truffle one was a nice twist, but to me all of them had way overcooked noodles. but maybe that's perfect for a preschooler who doesn't appreciate al dente pasta.

- kale/pear salad: nice fresh inviting salad with a great mixture of textures and flavors.

- Tijuana sandwich: another fresh and inviting taste. a little spiciness with tons of great textures and flavors.

our two favorites:

- the Ahi Avacado Poke which was wonderfully flavored, the fish was very fresh, and the portion was nicely sized for what we paid.

- the Ahi tuna + watermelon radish was a feast for the eyes and palate. it's not quite what you expect when you look at it, but if you are adventurous and willing to try something new, you are in for a delightful experience of texture, taste and flavor.

one thing i should note is that often restaurants try too hard in putting too many things/flavors into one dish. for the last four items mentioned above, the chef found the right balance of complementary flavors and textures.

(for some of the other items we tried, that was not the case)

anyway, at least for this location: give it a shot. at least go in and try a few sample. the staff was generous and patient in letting us try things out. if you don't like the samples, then nothing lost except a little time. but if you like to explore some new food at moderate pricing, i'd give Lemonade a shot.
author: Derek F.

description: We ordered via Uber Eats. We ordered 4 items but only received 3. they did not include our Curry cauliflower. The chicken thighs on the menu came instead as one chicken leg attached to a thigh. Not worth the $7,  and totally not what was as described on the menu. Also the Lemonade's are nothing but sugar and water. We ordered two lemonades... one that says watermelon with rosemary, but it was just water, sugar, maybe two tablespoons of watermelon juice and zero Rosemary. Will never order from this place again.
author: Denise Z.

description: When I lived in San Diego, Lemonade was one of my favorite places to eat. When I heard they were opening a location in San Francisco I was super excited! Lemonade takes a simple idea and turns it into a nice, delicious dining experience. It's like a lunch line! You pick everything you want and it is spread out in different sections. The staff is super friendly and helpful as well. I recommend the mashed potatoes. They are AMAZING. Of course, I will be returning really soon.
author: Korra B.

description:
Lemonade might have been so popular in LA but after I try out once it didn't go wrong with my expectation.
Lots of good healthy looking Market section salads are very flavorless and compromised with 
sweetness.
The worst thing was that Apple smoked bbq beef that comes with too sweet bbq sauce.
Why all thing became this much sweeter as soon as arrive in America?
author: Piano B.

description:
I feel like for $2.95 the portions were a bit small. I tried 5 different dishes including mashed potatoes, mac n cheese, guac w/ tomatoes, cauliflower and kimchi noodles.

I wouldn't say it was the best but it wasn't bad either. I'm having mixed feelings about this place.

The lemonade was a bit sour for me but it might taste good for some.

I wouldn't go all the way to brunch in this place.
author: Kathy D.

description: Incompetent people who work here. Takes 20 minutes to make 1 SANDWICH!  And it doesn't taste good!!!  What a waste!  Don't come here unless you want to waste your time and money!
author: Marsha L.

description:
Awesome salads! We tried about 5 of them and each of them were stellar. Love the sugar free lemonades as well. The hot food was not bad but nothing great.

The service was amazing and very friendly staff.
author: Karthick S.

description: I Love this place! Healthy eats, so colorful and rich. Vegetarian & vegan options too. And all the varieties of lemonade yummm!
author: Candice N.

description:
The food was underwhelming, pricy for what it is, flavorless, served by a clueless staff. Only cold vegan choices, weird blends of salads, without anything great. The lamb meatballs were described as three tough bland balls in a flavorful sauce.
 The salad preparer seemed overwhelmed. He couldn't figure out the dressings, We waited several minutes for one dressing and that was harshly flavored. He reused the same bowl as the portion control so you got an interesting blend of other salads mixed in with your choice. 
Wandered back and forth to figure out what to order and when I asked questions of the staff I got little help. 
I'm not sure if I'd go back. There are some great choices for sit down, well made meals within one block for about the same price.
author: Art R.

description:
We were wandering around the area for a place to eat and saw that Lemonade finally opened.  There are so many employees behind the counter. They are well staffed. I tried the poke which is different from traditional poke. It had tangerine pieces, avocado and seaweed.  It was good and I'd order again. The cup of broccoli soup was good but not great.

Hubby really liked his turkey sandwich but after consuming 1/2 the sandwich there was something not right with the 2nd half.  The General manager happened to walk by and she fixed the problem immediately.  That's good business practice. We didn't try any lemonade on this trip but plan to when the weather is warmer.
author: Ry T.

description:
Looking forward to a chain in my hood. Who would have thunk? Nineth Avenue local, come on down, it's your turn.

The staff was great at WP's Lemonade. It was a night it was pouring. WAY kid centric, that is okay, the play party place is next door, so it is bound to cross over.

*great, fresh, tasty selections on everything. if you cannot find something, well then, you ARE a fussy eater.
*Lamb stew with tasty balls, a must.
* The tuna tar-tar great, especially with the citrus.
*All the veggie dishes worked for me, esp. the tenderloin fingerling dish as well as the sweet potatoe/squash side.
*Everything worked and I would imagine the patio is great on a nice day, when there was not a flash flood warning.
*wanted to try all the fresh drinks but truly enjoyed the bloodorange lemonade and the pomogranite ade as well.
*dinner parnter had dessert, I had a bite, good selection there as well.

So, I can let that they are from LA go, there are brining a unique, good price point product to the Bay Area.

Now make up with the Carpenters and finish the Inner Sunset's location!
author: Joe Bob J.

description:
A friend raved about this place yesterday so I decided to bring my son here today. Walked in, and stood there, waiting, while nobody acknowledged me. Finally someone asked what I wanted. I ordered a kids grilled cheese and a provolone grilled cheese.

25 minutes later, they finally brought the sandwiches to the table. My provolone was barely melted and the bread was soggy.

My son's grilled cheese was also marginally melted. 

Rather odd. I doubt we'll come back at this point. Too bad.
author: Holly B.

description: Very very nice food (fresh and flavorful),  great atmosphere, and friendly staff. But... this place needs an experience re-design. There are multiple layers to ordering - Marketplace Salads , (with 3 subtypes of salads), Land &Sea, Leafy Greens, Hot Dishes and Sandwich stations along a cafeteria style line. On top of this there are bundled "Plates" - e.g. The Big Chill, Farmers Marketplace, Cozy Comfort, etc.- which combine components for each of the other stations. It's so complicated that they have a handout menu (that doesn't make it clear), and the staff - of which there are many (surprising how many given how slow the line moves) don't even know what the Plates include.  are either. So the entire ordering process is much more complicated than it needs to be - major issue when you're in the neighborhood that is filled with families with young children. Great potential- not there yet.
author: David F.

description:
I am so happy Lemonade has made its way to NorCal and even in closer proximity! Like most Lemonade I've been to, this one is pretty standard. You order kind of buffet style and you pay when you get to the cashier. 

I always enjoy walking by the food and deciding what to get. I really love their poke, brussel sprouts, and truffle mac n' cheese. These are probably their stables to Lemonade. I did hear that they change their menu once a while so you always get a pretty good variety of food. I always end my meal with a blood orange lemonade, which is my absolute favorite! The guava lemonade is also tasty, but too bad that one is only seasonal. 

Overall, this is a great spot if you're looking to eat a healthier meal. Yes, it could get pricey depending on what you get and how much you order. I do think it's reasonable for the quality of the food you're paying for. It's an once-in-a-while, and treat-yourself type of meal!
author: Wendy Y.

description: First time here was for lunch during the week, it's a fun spot. love the Lemon theme, contemporary style and cleanliness of the place. They have lots of offerings for vegans to meat eaters all in separate areas to pick and choose from. I had the Kale and kumquat salad and it was good, a bit bitter with sweet and slightly spicy due the red pepper. The tomato and avocado salad which was really yummy, both veggies were nicely ripe. Oh and then I indulged in the Salmon Louie Salad that also had avocado in a nice creamy dill sauce. I ordered Original Lemonade was perfect to wash it all down. To top it all off they have macarons the size of your palm I had the raspberry, it had that little crunchy exterior with a little chewy inside of the cookie and a light creamy strawberry filling, can you tell I liked it? They also had pistachio and caramel flavored. Definitely swing by this place.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: I had the best service, and welcoming experience. The workers were very kind, they gave me samples and offered suggestions on what type of food to eat. The manager was extremely helpful, on explaining the different types of food they offered. The food was delicious and healthy. I highly suggest the West Portal Lemonade it's definitely a great place to eat.
author: Marisela M.

description: This place has a really interesting concept but is kinda confusing to come alone. I would recommend a preordered plate rather than free styling which I did! Besides the confusing ordering process, the staff is helpful tho I wish they recommended a plate instead for my first time. The food is really good!! Also I just found it you can try samples which the worker did not tell me! I felt like she was just rushing me to get my order and be efficient which isn't the best especially as a first customer
author: Amani R.

description: This was a great place to hang out, the food tasted good and was not super over priced, there was only one tiny thing, they didn't really have much to drink besides lemonade and water, now this does not affect me but if someone wants a coke I did not see any maybe they were out, I just think they needed more drinks, otherwise the design was nice it was light and healthy food but filled me up. I definitely would go back, especially for their watermelon and rosemary lemonade.
author: Kyle F.

description: Pretty tasty but come well before closing. Love the southwest squash. The chicken salad sandwich was so good but limited time only. The actual lemonade is a little sweet so cut it with water
author: Joe P.

description: I was not impressed with Lemonade. I ordered Mac and cheese. It was barely warm. I asked to Jane it re-heated. It came back exactly the same temp. Not very warm or inviting. My server had unacceptable people skills. Did not even speak to my or smile. I felt like I was inconveniencing them. The Mac and cheese flavor was ok. I doubt I'll be back. To many excellent places to go on West Portal.
author: Michelle M.

description: Excellent cucumber mint lemonade, awesome vegetarian chili and the turkey blt mmmmmmm.... will retufn
author: Paul D.

description: If you want to get something to go, or need to get in and get out, this place is longer than In n outs drive thru. You say to yourself, let me grab something quick to eat at my desk, or i only have 20 mins on the meter that should be enough, wrong. They need to streamline the ordering process. You walk to the door and the line starts there. There is one person to help out with the items. If the person ordering decides to sample 5 items, you wait and wait and wait. Please make it easier to order your stuff to go. It should not take 1/2 hour to get brussel sprouts & an order of beets to go.
author: Pug P.

description: Arrived late about an hour before closing.  Out of sandwiches and food looked old. Lost my appetite.
author: jennifer m.

description: I use to go here for lunch. I work in the area and I stopped going because it got old and cost to much for the quality of food and service. but I thought to try it again. I paid for my sandwitch and said Ill be right back to pick it up. I came back and waited over 20 min while people were getting their lunch that came after me. they did nothing to help even when I said how long ive been waiting. they offered me a lemonade I said no thanks I'm not trying to get free stuff just good service. wont be going back.
author: Travis S.

description:
My first time at Lemonade and my experience was fine. It's just that there was nothing I ate that really blew me away and the prices are a little bit high.  I didn't mind the cafeteria style, but I can't say I'm a big fan of chain restaurants.  The Citrus Poached Salmon was well cooked, served cold and had good flavor.  The White Truffle Mac N Cheese was exactly what you'd expect, good, but nothing unique. The best part of my meal was the New Mexican Chili Roasted Butternut Squash, very flavorful and the most inexpensive thing on my plate.  
I opted to get the sugar-free Pomegranate Tarragon Lemonade, my strong advice, opt for the sweetened version. The staff was obviously new, very friendly, but over-eager considering all the choices to ponder.  
You can get samples of anything, but there's no place for you to put your dirty sample cup when you're done. So you have to leave it on your tray. It's a little awkward. 
Overall give it a marginal thumbs up, yet not someplace I'd enthusiastically recommend. I might go back to try a couple of the salads, since that's what people seem to be getting,  but in no rush.
author: Gary B.

description: I live very close to west portal and see this place all the time when I'm on the Muni and have been meaning to check it out. Finally got the chance to when my mom came to visit. The first thing we noticed was that there where A LOT of options, almost over whelming. The second thing, was the menu was not clear at all of how the place worked. By having the images of the food, it seemed like that's what you could order and everything else was sides.. but once we figured out how it worked it help. I was VERY surprised how many gluten free options they had! Which was great for me, since I'm trying to cut back on the gluten due to health. They are also vey generous in their portions. Overall, mom and I enjoyed our experience and the food.
author: Nikki H.

description: I ordered from their website for pickup since i was nearby. It was on a weekday before noon. It was my first time here.  It was clean, spacious with lots of tables & chairs and all organized in a cafeteria style like everyone posts.  The employees were all courteous and the order was on time. I expected to love their texas brisket but the size was pretty small-it was tasty but small for $8.  Their truffle oil mac n cheese was tasty & creamy and a good enough portion so no complaints.  I'm not a fan of overly sweetened drinks so their lemonade was way too sweet for me.  I have to say what blew my mind was their coconut cake-  the cake layers weren't just ordinairy sponge or regular cake layers.  Instead, all the cake layers were mixed with coconut so along with the coconut frosting, it really woke you up! It was very sweet but for a dessert, i don't mind it sweet.  I wanted to give it at least a 4 stars, but it doesn't pass my "price to value" score.  Of course, it's the pricey West Portal, but Calibur, Submarine Center, and Burrito Loco are less than half a block away and yet I view them as scoring higher.  It's hit or miss depending on what you order here.  When i come back in the future, i'll update.
author: Frugal C.

description: My plate literally only came with 5 pieces of tuna poke. Is that the usual serving size?
author: Priscilla T.

description: We went here for neighborhood preview day and loved it! West Portal has desperately needed a good salad place and this fits the bill.  It is cafeteria style and broken into sections (salads, grill, sandwiches, soups etc.) so you can pick and choose what you would like.  The food was fresh and varied. I had a butternut squash salad, hearts of palm salad and a salmon/avocado dish.  They were all excellent, as was the regular lemonade (fittingly).  I will definitely be going back.
author: Johanna W.

description: Lemonade has tasty dishes, but the price point is a little outrageous. I paid $7.50 for three Thai meatballs. My husband had the smallest poke bowl I've ever seen for $11.50. Really?! Tiny tiny tiny. I'm so disappointed.
author: Carol C.

description: I absolutely love this place, so I'm glad it finally made its way to SF. I like that everything is a la carte, so you can customize your own meal. This place is the perfect healthy lunch spot. I highly recommend ordering the shredded brussel sprouts, butternut squash, and seared ahi tuna. My absolute favorite thing from Lemonade is the watermelon rosemary lemonade.
author: Kyle S.

description: The place has been packed since they opened, food is good but some things bothered me: placing the silverware at the cashier is annoying because people keep getting in your way when they come back to get the silverware they forgot after they checked out. These things should be placed on the side. The sugar free watermelon rosemary drink was undrinkable, didn't taste good. Recommend watermelon mint instead. The last thing is that the yellow entrance doors are too heavy, and make carrying a tray difficult.
author: Domenique B.

description: Spontaneously popped in when I was trying to find a different restaurant this afternoon. Their food is fresh and innovative. I really liked their tuna poke and blood orange lemonade. It was a full house when I arrived and the line was nonstop while I ate.
author: Vivian L.

description: I ordered a Roasted Turkey BLT sandwich but when I got home, I was given another sandwhich and the place wasn't even crowded. Terrible.
author: Justin L.

description: I was so excited to try Lemonade since I love it in socal but it's just not the same up here. Everything just seems...soggy? I do give them props for keeping the prices relatively similar to the ones in LA but it feels like they sacrificed on something in the process. You can get a better $20 lunch elsewhere
author: Amanda B.

description: Had a really nice experience at Lemonade yesterday. Ordered one of the Poke Bowls with spicy tuna, yum. Great balance in flavors, average price, but worth ordering. Staff was friendly and helpful. Was greeted at the door by the manager and was given a nice walk through about how the process works, as it can seem like a lot to take in initially. Seating area inside was comfortable and cozy. Clean store, great service, and great food. I'll be back
author: Karla R.

description:
The staff work hard. But come early as they have very little near closing. The salads are attractive but highly over salted. 
It's good for a snack and the variety of lemonade's served are quite good. 
Otherwise, it's fair. Certainly miss the bakery that had been in the same space.
author: Phil B.

description: WARNING! Looks can be deceiving!! I've been wanting to try this place since it opened but avoided due to the long lines on the weekends. Finally had a chance to come on a Monday for lunch. Super SLOOOOOW to serve, given there was no line and only a handful of people. What was worse was the amount of SALT in the food! I had a scoop of the Red Quinoa & Fuji Apple, Snap Peas & Edamame and the Ahi Tuna & Avocado Poke. You'd think these would be light, and refreshing to eat because they look really good. The edamame was just ok, but the quinoa and the poke were the worse! OMG!! I think they dumped a cup of salt into each... do they even taste before putting the food out? Whoever's in the kitchen doing food prep has some F'd up taste buds! I couldn't finish eating it and dumped it. In hindsight, I should've taken it back and complained, so now I'm here writing this review. And I know I'm not the only Yelper with similar thoughts about the salt being used here. If you like eating a salt lick, this place is for you.  The peach ginger lemonade was the only thing I liked. Not sure I'll be eating here again. If I do, I'll ask for a taste first!
author: Betty L.

description: We have eaten there several times. The staff is super nice. Food was good but concerned about the temperature of hot entrees. The were luke warm at best. Not hot enough to kill bacteria. I took temp of food when I arrived home with thermo pen which is pretty accurate. Temp was 98 to 102 Too low for health dept even with time of transport home. Hope they address! Also last time I ate there I had salad. It tasted good but several bites were sandy and gritty. Disappointed
author: J J.

description: Overpriced for what it is, but convenient. The little vegan options are pretty bland and I often stand there wondering why I didn't just make this stuff at home. They also wrap their sandwiches in a way that they come undone when you open them and get all over the place. The lemonade is tasty and I won't want to know how much sugar is in them!
author: Bella S.

description: I have no idea what all the hype is about. The food is slightly above average, at best. And way overpriced for what you get.
author: AsianMom S.

description: Lemonade is one of my favorite spots but westportal was definitely a big fail. Whenever i go to the burlingame and yerba buena location the sandwiches are perfect. I ordered the tomato mozarella sandwhich and they not only forgot the olives it usually comes with and gives it flavor but it just looked sad. Big fail and very frustrating.
author: Laura E.

description: Tasty, quality is here, little portion (so different than usual american portion) ...  but really pricey for a family experience at a self service restaurant.
author: Frederique C.

description:
Food was four stars but my biggest issue was the really poor customer service. It took far too long to get some chicken with a couple of sides. The staff seemed only interested in their own social conversations rather than doing their job. (The one exception was the lady clearing the tables. She was working hard and was really nice.)

 Warning... it was also crowded, loud and somewhat claustrophobic. I'll probably go during the week when it's not so crazy.
author: David W.

description: Over priced, disgusting food. Over cooked noodles all soggy. Salmon was NASTYYY me and my friend both got it and took 2 bites. We couldn't even finish it.
author: Kyra D.

description:
Another update: I was told I would get my comp meal certificate in the mail and it never came. 

UPDATE: management has contacted me to assure me that will investigate and has offered to comp my next meal! Glad to see that customer service is a priority for them!

Got there when they first opened at 11 with two young kids, the woman was rude from the moment we walked in. I asked to for a sandwich, she said it was going to take longer because the sandwich maker was still making the display sandwiches...? I said fine and then proceeded to pay for what I thought was my sandwich and two grilled cheeses for the kids. Each grilled cheese was $10 and didn't come with a side! The kids sandwiches came out but not mine. I told the woman that I was still waiting on my sandwich so she should leave the number. She came back 5 min later and picked up the number. 10 minutes later, the kids had finished their lunches and I still had not gotten my sandwich. I asked the woman where it was and she said she never put my order in. She then said she would have them make it now but that I didn't pay earlier for my sandwich so I needed to pay now. I get that she made a mistake by not putting in my order and I was pretty understanding of that but then to charge me after her mistake. She then said "Sorry, it's been a slow morning." That's just bad customer service.
author: Bella T.

description: I went to Lemonade today and everything I tasted was delicious. But I noticed everything was a bit on the salty side. I ordered the salmon and avocado, chicken and cranberries, and brussel sprouts salad. As I was eating the brussel sprouts salad I had to spit it out of my mouth because there was a couple of hairs in the the salad. That completely grossed me out, so I threw everything away. I won't be going back there any time soon. I was very disappointed.
author: Deborah A.

description: I have to agree with other reviewers that the food is incredibly salty, which is definitely not in keeping with 'California cuisine.' Honestly, all three things I had today were oversalted and lacking in other flavors: kimchi soba noodles, arugula/apples and kale/kumquat salad. They need to retrain their line chefs on how much salt should be put in the recipes, because it makes the food hard to eat.
author: Mari W.

description: Severs were knowledgeable and friendly, made great recommendations as to what was most popular and what people seemed to like most. Accommodating in giving samples to try out and taste. Loved the blood orange lemonade here!
author: Candy L.

description: Love the decor and the cafeteria style serving, but HATE the food. It tastes bland and plasticky. They have these giant sandwiches on display for $9, but what they give you is literally half the size. Not sure how they can get away with the false advertising, but it shows you what kind of company this is. One great thing here though, the giant macaroons! They got those right. I really want to like this place, but after trying locations in LA and SF with the same experience, I won't be going to lemonade again.
author: M J.

description: This specific lemonade location has THE best customer service I have ever experienced. I really enjoy their food and especially their lemonade. It is a bit on the expensive side, but worth it. I would like to note this specific incident where this rude gentleman throws food at an employee because he thought they were ignoring him. In reality, it was a lunch rush and there was about 4 workers trying to serve about 25 people. The staff handled the situation EXTREMELY well and made sure the people around were okay when the rude gentleman through food at the ground. I also saw one of the workers helping out a handicapped man. She also took the time to make sure he was suffice. All in all, I enjoy this place because of the food and the GREAT customer service.
author: Rachel B.

description: I went for my first (& only) time the other day.  Plenty of hype so I wanted to check it out.  The food is OK, the service subpar & the price point pretty steep for what you get PLUS it is cafeteria style.  Plenty of better spots on West Portal.  I won't be back.
author: Joe D.

description: Amazing food! Everything tasted very fresh and there were lots of options for gluten-free and vegan folks. The flavors were inventive and interesting. This is not your average lunch spot
author: Ashley B.

description: I bought dinner for 4 of us---one is a vegetarian.  I needed some guidance since I was new to the place.  The young man at the first station was very cordial and helpful.  The food is delicious.  I bought the sesame lo mein noodles, the shaved brussel sprouts, the bar-b-que brisket, the chili lime chicken and truffle mac and cheese.  Everything was delicious, especially the bar-b-que brisket.  I will definitely go back. I'll try one of the lemonades on my next visit.
author: Andrea P.

description: Just opened, I went on the first day. It was fine but there was a big line. Some people cut the line and it was very loud. Food was pretty good and the Lemonade was excellent. Cost a lot for what it is but otherwise good
author: Izzy S.
